lexUnit.name: taste.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perceive or experience the flavour of.

sentence.text: History just burps , and we taste again that raw-onion sandwich it swallowed centuries ago . )
Coffin was almost glad to taste that the coffee was as mediocre as always .
Those who taste instant success usually falter quickly in the aftermath of their luck .
To taste it is to see something as strange and intangible as Rumi 's harvest of stars .
I can taste blood running down the back of my throat , then my arms are grabbed and everything just spins all colours and then black .
Ronni had rarely tasted anything quite so delicious .
He could taste his toothpaste on her lips .
He kissed her on the mouth and she tasted herself on his lips .
It was not raining , but droplets of moisture condensed on every cold surface and Wycliffe could taste the salt on his lips .
I tasted the salt on my lips and felt the sting of the cold , bitter air
I would rather taste ash on my tongue than blood in my mouth .
I tasted the storm before I saw it .
For a moment she found her lips on his smooth cheek , and she tasted salt from the spray of the boat journey .
Can you taste the clover in it ?
If you used pine you 'd taste it in the herren .
I could taste sharp water in my lungs and nostrils , but I could breathe .
I can taste the liquor in my throat , which I drank to still the pain in my heart . "
And she was thrilled by that , for she found it hard to come back to a woman 's life in Egypt after tasting life in France .
` I 'll bet you 've never tasted anything like it . "
The effect was instant -- McSwegan tasting the glory of scoring his first goal for Rangers , in such a vital match .
She had tasted the fear of being cast out , and it left a bitter taste in her mouth .
I 've been in the game for eight years and have never tasted such a chilling fear .
I can taste it ! "
She made the kind of face she made when tasting sour milk .
Dinner consisted of pea soup , which Millie found quite nice -- she could taste there had been some kind of pork boiled in the liquid -- followed by a meat pudding .
